title: Fragment (France), 18th century
medium:
Medium: wool embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in chain stitch (needle-made), knots and satin stitch on a 2/2 twill foundation
description: Piece of crewel embroidery colored yarns with scattered motifs in a grid arrangement.  The motifs do not repeat in a regular manner but alternate a florral motif [8 different ones, sometimes facing in different directions] with an animal or bird motif [8 different ones]   Different colors are used when a motif is repeated.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment (France), 18th century. Medium: wool embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in chain stitch (needle-made), knots and satin stitch on a 2/2 twill foundation. 
Gift of Mrs. H.P. Davison. 1974-72-12-b.
